title: Door vault
data:
***Version [0.25](/0.25 "0.25")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

The **door vault** is a particularly infamous and deadly series of [vaults](/Vault "Vault"). They can appear in the [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon") (D:13-15), in [the Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"), [the Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"), the [Elven Halls](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls"), [Hell](/Hell "Hell"), the [Crypt](/Crypt "Crypt"), or the [Realm of Zot](/Realm_of_Zot "Realm of Zot"), and can appear multiple times. A door vault consists of a 10x10 square that is primarily made up of layers of [doors](/Door "Door"), the outermost layer of which are runed doors. The innermost 16 squares contain many nasty out-of-depth monsters or just some [butterflies](/Butterfly "Butterfly").

Each door vault has about 8 good items of loot. Note that door vaults placed in Hell branches have several [escape hatches](/Escape_hatch "Escape hatch") instead of loot.

## Contents

- [1 Appearance](#Appearance)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 door\_vault](#door_vault)
  - [2.2 not\_door\_vault\_due](#not_door_vault_due)
  - [2.3 not\_door\_vault\_mu](#not_door_vault_mu)
  - [2.4 gammafunk\_ghost\_door\_vault](#gammafunk_ghost_door_vault)

- [3 History](#History)

## Appearance

```
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXX1111XXX
XXX1221XXX
XXX1221XXX
XXX1111XXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
```

All door vault variants look the same from the outside and can appear in the same branches. Followers of [Ashenzari](/Ashenzari "Ashenzari") can scry through doors to see what's inside.

## Variants

### door\_vault

The monster set includes difficult branch-specific monsters together with end-level branch spawns. For Vaults and the main dungeon, this means standard out-of-depth monsters: the crowd you'd usually see around Depths:5, including [shadow dragons](/Shadow_dragon "Shadow dragon") and [titans](/Titan "Titan"). The other branches have more specific monster sets:

- Elf: What you'd normally see in the final vault of the Elven Halls: [dancing weapons](/Dancing_weapon "Dancing weapon"), [deep elf blademasters](/Deep_elf_blademaster "Deep elf blademaster"), [annihilators](/Deep_elf_annihilator "Deep elf annihilator"), [sorcerers](/Deep_elf_sorcerer "Deep elf sorcerer"), [demonologists](/Deep_elf_demonologist "Deep elf demonologist"), [master archers](/Deep_elf_master_archer "Deep elf master archer"), [high priests](/Deep_elf_high_priest "Deep elf high priest"), and some regular monsters from Elf:3.

- Crypt: [Reapers](/Reaper "Reaper"), [ancient champions](/Ancient_champion "Ancient champion"), [flayed ghosts](/Flayed_ghost "Flayed ghost"), [revenants](/Revenant "Revenant"), [eidolons](/Eidolon "Eidolon"), [ancient liches](/Ancient_lich "Ancient lich"), [reapers](/Reaper "Reaper"), [curse skulls](/Curse_skull "Curse skull"), and [vampire knights](/Vampire_knight "Vampire knight"). Somewhat diluted by normal Crypt:3 monsters, but still, expect nastiness.

- Hell: Varies by branch. In each case there is a small chance of a square containing a normal monster for the last floor the branch.

  - Tartarus: [Tzitzimimeh](/Tzitzimimeh "Tzitzimimeh"), [doom hounds](/Doom_hound "Doom hound"), [bone dragons](/Bone_dragon "Bone dragon"), [tormentors](/Tormentor "Tormentor"), [death drakes](/Death_drake "Death drake"), [shadow demons](/Shadow_demon "Shadow demon"), and [ancient liches](/Ancient_lich "Ancient lich").
  - Cocytus: [Ice fiends](/Ice_fiend "Ice fiend"), [titans](/Titan "Titan"), [blizzard demons](/Blizzard_demon "Blizzard demon"), [ancient liches](/Ancient_lich "Ancient lich"), [tormentors](/Tormentor "Tormentor"), and occasional [shard shrikes](/Shard_shrike "Shard shrike").
  - Gehenna: [Brimstone fiends](/Brimstone_fiend "Brimstone fiend"), [tormentors](/Tormentor "Tormentor"), [hellions](/Hellion "Hellion"), [balrugs](/Balrug "Balrug"), [hell sentinels](/Hell_sentinel "Hell sentinel"), and [ancient liches](/Ancient_lich "Ancient lich").
  - Dis: Any [fiend](/Fiend "Fiend"), [hell sentinels](/Hell_sentinel "Hell sentinel"), [tormentors](/Tormentor "Tormentor"), [hellions](/Hellion "Hellion"), [shadow demons](/Shadow_demon "Shadow demon"), [iron giants](/Iron_giant "Iron giant").

- Zot: Expect to see many non-base [draconians](/Draconian_\(monster\) "Draconian (monster)"), in addition to [orbs of fire](/Orbs_of_fire "Orbs of fire"), [curse toes](/Curse_toe "Curse toe"), [Killer Klowns](/Killer_Klown "Killer Klown"), [electric golems](/Electric_golem "Electric golem"), and [ancient liches](/Ancient_lich "Ancient lich").

### not\_door\_vault\_due

The monster set includes [hell hogs](/Hell_hog "Hell hog") and [hell hounds](/Hell_hound "Hell hound") for the [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon"), a chaotic theme for [Elven Halls](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls") and [Zot](/Zot "Zot") ([very ugly things](/Very_ugly_thing "Very ugly thing"), [apocalypse crabs](/Apocalypse_crab "Apocalypse crab"), [shapeshifters](/Shapeshifter_\(monster\) "Shapeshifter (monster)"), and [Killer Klowns](/Killer_Klown "Killer Klown") in Zot), and a mix of [hell knights](/Hell_knight "Hell knight"), [hellions](/Hellion "Hellion") and [balrugs](/Balrug "Balrug") for other branches. At least one [hellephant](/Hellephant "Hellephant") is always present, and additional ones are added, scaling with the depth of placement, up to four guaranteed hellephants in [Gehenna](/Gehenna "Gehenna") and [Dis](/Dis "Dis").

### not\_door\_vault\_mu

This variant places only [butterflies](/Butterfly "Butterfly"). Free loot!

### gammafunk\_ghost\_door\_vault

This vault places up to 10 [player ghosts](/Player_ghost "Player ghost") and some dangerous branch-specific monsters, similar to **door\_vault**. The loot is usually better than in the other variants. This variation doesn't appear in Hell branches.

## History

- In [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), a player ghost door vault variant was added. All four door vaults can appear on the same floors, including D:13-14 and the Vaults. The "elephant" door vault variant was reworked to replace [elephants](/Elephant "Elephant") and [dire elephants](/Dire_elephant "Dire elephant") with hell-, demon-, or chaos-themed monsters. Also, the door vaults place some loot now.
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), the outermost doors of a door vault were hidden rather than runed. This meant that wandering monsters could and would happily open the vault for you, releasing the contents for you to encounter as you explored the floor.
- This vault has been taking out players for many versions now. In older versions, though, it was somewhat kinder when it appeared outside of the Vaults or the main Dungeon, tending to contain monsters that were simply appropriate to the branch end. However, the game itself did not provide any warning as to the vault's nature, and preventing autoexplore from opening it would require manually excluding all of the outermost still-closed doors.
html:
Door vault

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.25: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

The door vault is a particularly infamous and deadly series of vaults. They can appear in the Dungeon (D:13-15), in the Depths, the Vaults, the Elven Halls, Hell, the Crypt, or the Realm of Zot, and can appear multiple times. A door vault consists of a 10x10 square that is primarily made up of layers of doors, the outermost layer of which are runed doors. The innermost 16 squares contain many nasty out-of-depth monsters or just some butterflies.

Each door vault has about 8 good items of loot. Note that door vaults placed in Hell branches have several escape hatches instead of loot.

Contents

  • 1 Appearance
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 door_vault
    • 2.2 not_door_vault_due
    • 2.3 not_door_vault_mu
    • 2.4 gammafunk_ghost_door_vault
  • 3 History

Appearance

XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXX1111XXX
XXX1221XXX
XXX1221XXX
XXX1111XXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX

All door vault variants look the same from the outside and can appear in the same branches. Followers of Ashenzari can scry through doors to see what's inside.

Variants

door_vault

The monster set includes difficult branch-specific monsters together with end-level branch spawns. For Vaults and the main dungeon, this means standard out-of-depth monsters: the crowd you'd usually see around Depths:5, including shadow dragons and titans. The other branches have more specific monster sets:

  • Elf: What you'd normally see in the final vault of the Elven Halls: dancing weapons, deep elf blademasters, annihilators, sorcerers, demonologists, master archers, high priests, and some regular monsters from Elf:3.
  • Crypt: Reapers, ancient champions, flayed ghosts, revenants, eidolons, ancient liches, reapers, curse skulls, and vampire knights. Somewhat diluted by normal Crypt:3 monsters, but still, expect nastiness.
  • Hell: Varies by branch. In each case there is a small chance of a square containing a normal monster for the last floor the branch.
    • Tartarus: Tzitzimimeh, doom hounds, bone dragons, tormentors, death drakes, shadow demons, and ancient liches.
    • Cocytus: Ice fiends, titans, blizzard demons, ancient liches, tormentors, and occasional shard shrikes.
    • Gehenna: Brimstone fiends, tormentors, hellions, balrugs, hell sentinels, and ancient liches.
    • Dis: Any fiend, hell sentinels, tormentors, hellions, shadow demons, iron giants.
  • Zot: Expect to see many non-base draconians, in addition to orbs of fire, curse toes, Killer Klowns, electric golems, and ancient liches.

not_door_vault_due

The monster set includes hell hogs and hell hounds for the Dungeon, a chaotic theme for Elven Halls and Zot (very ugly things, apocalypse crabs, shapeshifters, and Killer Klowns in Zot), and a mix of hell knights, hellions and balrugs for other branches. At least one hellephant is always present, and additional ones are added, scaling with the depth of placement, up to four guaranteed hellephants in Gehenna and Dis.

not_door_vault_mu

This variant places only butterflies. Free loot!

gammafunk_ghost_door_vault

This vault places up to 10 player ghosts and some dangerous branch-specific monsters, similar to door_vault. The loot is usually better than in the other variants. This variation doesn't appear in Hell branches.

History

  • In 0.25, a player ghost door vault variant was added. All four door vaults can appear on the same floors, including D:13-14 and the Vaults. The "elephant" door vault variant was reworked to replace elephants and dire elephants with hell-, demon-, or chaos-themed monsters. Also, the door vaults place some loot now.
  • Prior to 0.12, the outermost doors of a door vault were hidden rather than runed. This meant that wandering monsters could and would happily open the vault for you, releasing the contents for you to encounter as you explored the floor.
  • This vault has been taking out players for many versions now. In older versions, though, it was somewhat kinder when it appeared outside of the Vaults or the main Dungeon, tending to contain monsters that were simply appropriate to the branch end. However, the game itself did not provide any warning as to the vault's nature, and preventing autoexplore from opening it would require manually excluding all of the outermost still-closed doors.

rawPage:
{{version025}}

The '''door vault''' is a particularly infamous and deadly series of [[vault]]s. They can appear in the [[Dungeon]] (D:13-15), in [[the Depths]], [[the Vaults]], the [[Elven Halls]], [[Hell]], the [[Crypt]], or the [[Realm of Zot]], and can appear multiple times. A door vault consists of a 10x10 square that is primarily made up of layers of [[door]]s, the outermost layer of which are runed doors. The innermost 16 squares contain many nasty out-of-depth monsters or just some [[butterfly|butterflies]].

Each door vault has about 8 good items of loot. Note that door vaults placed in Hell branches have several [[escape hatch]]es instead of loot.

==Appearance==
 XXXXXXXXXX
 XXXXXXXXXX
 XXXXXXXXXX
 XXX1111XXX
 XXX1221XXX
 XXX1221XXX
 XXX1111XXX
 XXXXXXXXXX
 XXXXXXXXXX
 XXXXXXXXXX

All door vault variants look the same from the outside and can appear in the same branches. Followers of [[Ashenzari]] can scry through doors to see what's inside.

==Variants==
===door_vault===
The monster set includes difficult branch-specific monsters together with end-level branch spawns. For Vaults and the main dungeon, this means standard out-of-depth monsters: the crowd you'd usually see around Depths:5, including [[shadow dragon]]s and [[titan]]s. The other branches have more specific monster sets:

*Elf: What you'd normally see in the final vault of the Elven Halls: [[dancing weapon]]s, [[deep elf blademaster]]s, [[deep elf annihilator|annihilators]], [[deep elf sorcerer|sorcerers]], [[deep elf demonologist|demonologists]], [[deep elf master archer|master archers]], [[deep elf high priest|high priests]], and some regular monsters from Elf:3.
*Crypt: [[Reaper]]s, [[ancient champion]]s, [[flayed ghost]]s, [[revenant]]s, [[eidolon]]s, [[ancient lich]]es, [[reaper]]s, [[curse skull]]s, and [[vampire knight]]s. Somewhat diluted by normal Crypt:3 monsters, but still, expect nastiness.
*Hell: Varies by branch. In each case there is a small chance of a square containing a normal monster for the last floor the branch.
**Tartarus: [[Tzitzimimeh]], [[doom hound]]s, [[bone dragon]]s, [[tormentor]]s, [[death drake]]s, [[shadow demon]]s, and [[ancient lich]]es.
**Cocytus: [[Ice fiend]]s, [[titan]]s, [[blizzard demon]]s, [[ancient lich]]es, [[tormentor]]s, and occasional [[shard shrike]]s.
**Gehenna: [[Brimstone fiend]]s, [[tormentor]]s, [[hellion]]s, [[balrug]]s, [[hell sentinel]]s, and [[ancient lich]]es.
**Dis: Any [[fiend]], [[hell sentinel]]s, [[tormentor]]s, [[hellion]]s, [[shadow demon]]s, [[iron giant]]s.
*Zot: Expect to see many non-base [[draconian (monster)|draconian]]s, in addition to [[orbs of fire]], [[curse toe]]s, [[Killer Klown]]s, [[electric golem]]s, and [[ancient lich]]es.

===not_door_vault_due===
The monster set includes [[hell hog]]s and [[hell hound]]s for the [[Dungeon]], a chaotic theme for [[Elven Halls]] and [[Zot]] ([[very ugly thing]]s, [[apocalypse crab]]s, [[shapeshifter (monster)|shapeshifter]]s, and [[Killer Klown]]s in Zot), and a mix of [[hell knight]]s, [[hellion]]s and [[balrug]]s for other branches. At least one [[hellephant]] is always present, and additional ones are added, scaling with the depth of placement, up to four guaranteed hellephants in [[Gehenna]] and [[Dis]].

===not_door_vault_mu===
This variant places only [[butterfly|butterflies]]. Free loot!

===gammafunk_ghost_door_vault===
This vault places up to 10 [[player ghost]]s and some dangerous branch-specific monsters, similar to '''door_vault'''. The loot is usually better than in the other variants. This variation doesn't appear in Hell branches.

==History==
*In [[0.25]], a player ghost door vault variant was added. All four door vaults can appear on the same floors, including D:13-14 and the Vaults. The "elephant" door vault variant was reworked to replace [[elephant]]s and [[dire elephant]]s with hell-, demon-, or chaos-themed monsters. Also, the door vaults place some loot now.
*Prior to [[0.12]], the outermost doors of a door vault were hidden rather than runed. This meant that wandering monsters could and would happily open the vault for you, releasing the contents for you to encounter as you explored the floor.
*This vault has been taking out players for many versions now. In older versions, though, it was somewhat kinder when it appeared outside of the Vaults or the main Dungeon, tending to contain monsters that were simply appropriate to the branch end. However, the game itself did not provide any warning as to the vault's nature, and preventing autoexplore from opening it would require manually excluding all of the outermost still-closed doors.
